solution_line_template: Of her original {initial_apples} apples, Sarah gave five to friends, meaning she has no more than {initial_apples}-{friends_given}=<<{initial_apples}-{friends_given}={apples_after_friends}>>{apples_after_friends} apples available to give to teachers.

She ate one while walking home, meaning she had no more than {apples_after_friends}-{ate_walking_home}=<<{apples_after_friends}-{ate_walking_home}={apples_after_eating}>>{apples_after_eating} apples available to give to teachers.

And since she had three apples remaining when she got home, then the amount she had given to teachers was {apples_after_eating}-{apples_left_at_home}=<<{apples_after_eating}-{apples_left_at_home}={apples_given_to_teachers}>>{apples_given_to_teachers} apples.
